cont.entity_a: Cuts through aluminum and PVC cleanly without lubricant. Cuts tough aluminum efficiently. Cuts extruded aluminum and 2" angle like wood. Cuts smoothly with no vibration or chatter. Cuts 80/20 extruded aluminum effectively. Cuts aluminum tubing cleanly with minimal touching up. Works great for cutting aluminum and other metals.
cont.entity_b: Cuts well but dulls quickly. Cuts through 1/4 inch steel like butter. Works well on Milwaukee saw. Great blade for cutting heavier gauge mild steel.

cont.entity_a: Thicker and heavier blade stabilizes cuts. Built heavy for stability in cutting.
First blade lasted over three years cutting aluminum without problems. Blade remains sharp after hundreds of cuts. Long-lasting with good performance.
cont.entity_b: Blade jammed and bent after about 100 cuts. Tooth fell off almost immediately. Dull after roughly 30 cuts. Factory Evolution blade lasted longer. Made 500+ cuts before dulling. Lasts longer than cheaper blades. Tips break off quickly. Gets about 750-900 cuts. Longest lasting blade used so far.
Cost is almost twice that of the Evolution equivalent. Good value for the money.

cont.entity_a: Impressive finish comparable to a wet horizontal bandsaw. Extremely pleased with performance. Cleanest and smoothest cut on aluminum.
cont.entity_b: Dewalt blades are now made in China, reducing quality. Chinese-made blades expected to have subpar life and quality. DeWalt blade outperforms others despite missing teeth.

Heat.comm: Leaves a nice clean edge with minimal heat.

cont.entity_a: Minimal burrs and heat buildup with lubrication. Cuts smoothly with no sparks or heat.
Used WD-40 as lubricant for cutting. Lubrication extends blade life.
No chatter on thin or thick stock. Smooth cutting action without chatter. Vibration damping slots reduce chatter. Cuts cleanly and precisely with no vibration or gouging.
Best blade for metal cutting on a woodworking chip saw.
cont.entity_b: Great cold saw blade for metal. Best aluminum cutting blade on the market.

cont.entity_a: Saved from buying an expensive tool.
